revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-26 09:08:14.000000000', 'message': 'test_rpc: "deepcopy" global options

We're seeing stacktraces like this in our tests:

  Fatal Python error: Cannot recover from stack overflow.

  Current thread 0x00007fe66549f740 (most recent call first):
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2183 in __getattr__
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2183 in __getattr__
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    ...

From a look at the oslo.config source, this seems to be occurring
because 'ConfigOpts.__cache' is somehow undefined, which results in the
'_get' method attempting to call '__getattr__' [1], which calls '_get'
[2], which calls '__getattr__' and so on.

This unsetting on 'ConfigOpts.__cache' only happens on Python 3.6 and
isn't reproducible, however, it also only fails with specific tests;
tests where we're copying and resetting global variables in order to
prevent leaking state. These copies are shallow copies rather than deep
copies, meaning some transient state isn't included in the copy. It's
possible that this use of shallowcopy is causing these issues under
specific circumstances. Switch to deepcopy in an attempt to avoid _any_
sharing of state between tests and, hopefully, avoid the issue entirely.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/6.8.1/oslo_config/cfg.py#L2614
[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/6.8.1/oslo_config/cfg.py#L2183

Change-Id: I468cef94185a1b59f379ca527050450e03664c67
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1825435
'}, {'created': '2019-04-26 11:21:51.000000000', 'message': 'test_rpc: Stop f****** with global state

We're occasionally seeing stacktraces like this in our tests:

  Fatal Python error: Cannot recover from stack overflow.

  Current thread 0x00007fe66549f740 (most recent call first):
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2183 in __getattr__
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2183 in __getattr__
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    ...

From a look at the oslo.config source, this seems to be occurring
because 'ConfigOpts.__cache' is somehow undefined, which results in the
'_get' method attempting to call '__getattr__' [1], which calls '_get'
[2], which calls '__getattr__' and so on.

The exact reason this is happening isn't clear, but what is clear is
that how we handle global config options in the tests that are failing
is very strange and potentially subject to race conditions. We have a
clear pattern for mocking everything and anything - the mock module -
and we should be using this here. Start doing so, reworking a lot of the
tests in the process, in order to avoid messing with oslo.config and
triggering the issue entirely.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/6.8.1/oslo_config/cfg.py#L2614
[2] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/6.8.1/oslo_config/cfg.py#L2183

Change-Id: I468cef94185a1b59f379ca527050450e03664c67
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1825435
'}]
commit_message:
test_rpc: Stop f****** with global state

We're occasionally seeing stacktraces like this in our tests:

  Fatal Python error: Cannot recover from stack overflow.

  Current thread 0x00007fe66549f740 (most recent call first):
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2183 in __getattr__
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2183 in __getattr__
    File "...nova/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_config/cfg.py", line 2614 in _get
    ...

From a look at the oslo.config source, this seems to be occurring
because 'ConfigOpts.__cache' is somehow undefined, which results in the
'_get' method attempting to call '__getattr__' [1], which calls '_get'
[2], which calls '__getattr__' and so on.

The exact reason this is happening isn't clear, but what is clear is
that how we handle global config options in the tests that are failing
is very strange and potentially subject to race conditions. We have a
clear pattern for mocking everything and anything - the mock module -
and we should be using this here. Start doing so, reworking a lot of the
tests in the process, in order to avoid messing with oslo.config and
triggering the issue entirely.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/6.8.1/oslo_config/cfg.py#L2614

commit_message:
Add OpenSUSE Leap15 testing

There is currently no testing of the Leap 15 images in OSH.

This addresses it by:
- Using the values_overrides folder according to the multi-os
  spec, creating value override files there for changes that
  needs to happen on Leap 15 images.
- Point to the right images using the previously created folder,
  to allow using those in CI easily.
- Change CI to use previously created overrides.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/651501
Change-Id: I520d3676195c62b253a19397c86b0d0fbabee710

commit_message:
Drop admin endpoints and cache dirs

The admin endpoints offer no special functionality, users may talk to
the public endpoints instead. The only historic use case has been the
keystone v2 admin endpoint, but with keystone v3 API, even that is no
longer needed.

Also stop creating cache dirs that were only needed while keystone
supported PKI tokens.

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-specs/src/branch/master/specs/ocata/all/drop-admin-endpoints.rst

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/652050
Change-Id: I58f1c442dc472c8e96ca7bfaf03577d14ca65cd5

[{'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-04-29 14:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-04-29 14:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why do you think that consistency with other projects is beneficial for this repo?'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-04-29 14:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-04-29 14:54:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sorry maybe is not necessary. Simply I think it's good when the subprojects of a big project to be harmonize."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-04-29 14:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

in this case it does not give any benefit IMHO, since new versions work just fine. So, a version used elsewhere is working here as well.

Also, you make nowhere a change that uses the newer tox. Once we do it, we can change...'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-04-29 14:59:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The minversion setting is used to declare the lowest version of tox this configuration file is usable with. There is no reason to increase it unless you have evidence that tox 1.6 can't work with the current configuration we have."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-04-29 15:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Similarly, we have ceased requiring OpenStack projects to "harmonize" on minimum versions of Python dependencies, and allow them to declare the lowest versions each repository individually is capable of using.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-04-29 15:03:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Natal, I propose to abandon this change, it's really not needed."}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-04-29 15:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The team disagree.'}]

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I09222df09e6c6618a06a08479638be3953e19ed4

commit_message:
Port tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone to os_tempest

Vars changes made for os_tempest:
tempest_plugins -> tempest_services
tempest_workers -> tempest_run_concurrency
tempest_extra_config -> tempest_tempest_conf_overrides
tempest_whitelist -> tempest_test_whitelist

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/906

Change-Id: Icefe04d7b0e9981038a0428e1390051fef1563f4
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop setting auth_version in DEFAULT section of nova.conf

This option never belonged there anyway, we hardcode to "v3" in the
keystone_authtoken section already.

commit_message:
Fix nova placement image name

The name of the placement image doesn't match with what is generated
by Kolla[1]. This change fixes that mismatch.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kolla/tree/master/docker/nova/nova-placement-api

Change-Id: I8d246adca65c4a31d6f3c88450387749a282b20c

commit_message:
mistral: Fix rundir handling

For any distro that uses systemd, /run is on tmpfs so we need to use
the systemd logic for dynamically generating rundir rather than
installing that. fixes lint failure on SUSE.

Also includes

mistral: Remove hacking/pep8 tests
We don't want to run theses again in our CI.

  Change-Id: I599b1055cb7aab4416ecc7560f35ca582d8d0696
  (cherry picked from commit 7ad4010643e559746997b1a675751dd2c9c78747)

Change-Id: I6f5e5a5bf9b59c65b667e615fee77d5a8775d70e

commit_message:
nova: Cleanup specfile

This is a basic cleanup and also a sync with the approach we are using
for other spec templates (eg the defaultconf). Also some of the SUSE
stuff we currently have downstream was added.

Change-Id: I88dbdd9981b05f65b1d6f3b0f0cb0a7fb29b296b
(cherry picked from commit 2dc1598191d3557f284c3a4dd8b22d283bfa1b7b)

commit_message:
Fetch upper constraints from opendev.org

the imagebuild/common/generate_upper_constraints.sh
is currently failing as the curl command in this file does not
handle redirects.

Instead of allowing redirects, use the proper current link to the
upper constraints file.

Change-Id: I92c5bfa65ba149687f61172c2a89ff38660a58cf
(cherry picked from commit 93dae93d52c8eec10d4e94f16b460443075ec129)

[{'created': '2019-04-24 20:49:29.000000000', 'message': "Remove ceph-ansible fetch directory after it is saved

Because the ceph-ansible fetch directory is backed up to Swift
or the directory defined by LocalCephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup,
it is safe to delete it after ceph-ansible has run. If we need
to apply a system update, the fetch directory will be restored
each time before ceph-ansible is run and it will then subsequently
be backed up and deleted.

During the restore, problems can occur if the update is being run
by a different user or if the restore tries to overwrite metadata.
Rather than try to handle this by setting permissions or passing
metadata overwrite flags, it is simpler to just ensure that each
restore is a restore to a new copy of the fetch directory.

Also, remove the task which removes nested sections of fetch
directory (if any) and remove registrations of nested sections.
This task's goal was to clean the fetch directory which would
continue to exist on the filesystem. Since that directory is
now being fully removed there is nothing to clean.

Change-Id: I7a01146a135254ccb948b8e793859f8fa3bdc690
Closes-Bug: #1823229

commit_message:
Remove ceph-ansible fetch directory after it is saved

Because the ceph-ansible fetch directory is backed up to Swift
or the directory defined by LocalCephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup,
it is safe to delete it after ceph-ansible has run. If we need
to apply a system update, the fetch directory will be restored
each time before ceph-ansible is run and it will then subsequently
be backed up and deleted.

During the restore, problems can occur if the update is being run
by a different user or if the restore tries to overwrite metadata.
Rather than try to handle this by setting permissions or passing
metadata overwrite flags, it is simpler to just ensure that each
restore is a restore to a new copy of the fetch directory.

Also, remove the task which removes nested sections of fetch
directory (if any) and remove registrations of nested sections.
This task's goal was to clean the fetch directory which would
continue to exist on the filesystem. Since that directory is
now being fully removed there is nothing to clean.

Change-Id: I7a01146a135254ccb948b8e793859f8fa3bdc690
Closes-Bug: #1823229

commit_message:
Move to opendev

1.Use opendev.org instead of git.openstack.org.
2.Use review.opendev.org instead of review.openstack.org.

You can see the discussion below:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003603.html

Change-Id: I377ea63827b6f3995ee275fdc466c1b2100eafc7

messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-04-22 11:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23999, 'date': '2019-04-22 12:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-04-22 13:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-04-23 09:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-23 09:08:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm clearly missing some context, but the commit message talks about generate_upper_constraints.sh, while the commit modifies tox.ini. The value in tox.ini is expected, and should not, ideally, be changed."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-04-23 09:34:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

imagebuild/common/generate_upper_constraints.sh takes the url from tox.ini but curl can't process the redirect correctly, so changing the url in tox.ini seems like the only viable solution.
I also believe this is a legitimate change and consistent with the migration to the new repo location."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-23 09:41:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/stein is the correct upper-constraints location, that is designed to hide from us cases like moving repositories. If we don't handle redirects, we need to fix our code, not revert the change that the release team made.."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-04-23 10:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

if that is a common url and supposed to work in all cases, then I agree with you
In that case we probably need to consider reverting this change on master:
https://review.opendev.org/654430'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-04-23 10:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:46:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

After IRC discussions, I think this particular link is correct, and we should fix our scripts to allow redirects.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-04-25 10:34:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

this link is actually now doing 2 redirects (with different HTTP status):

  $ curl --head https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/master
  HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently
  Location: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=master
  
  $ curl --head http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=master
  HTTP/1.1 302 Found
  Location: https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/raw/branch/master/upper-constraints.txt

Since we'll have to make a patch anyway, why not set the correct direct link?

I could add -L to curl invocation too, but using a canonical authoritative link is still proper IMO."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-25 11:54:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Okay, I guess it won't hurt (unless we migrate again, lol)"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-04-29 14:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Bump OpenStack service versions (Rocky)

This includes a bump for bifrost, which is necessary to fix an issue
with the conductor failing to start due to an unpinned proliantutils
dependency.

Change-Id: I40e83c48fb50509c37308faffe069a4dd766a301

commit_message:
Limit neutron version to rocky only

openstack-tox-py27 and build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail with
seemingly using neutron from latest master, so this patch adds
constraint for neutron (version should be less than 1st b1 release
of neutron from stein)

Change-Id: Ic799e8f9fa3c418907e4269fc7dd0fbb0c8394bc

commit_message:
DNM: debug infinite recursion in ConfigOpts._get()

A nova change will depend on this to try and recreate.
The point is to try and raise an error to generate a
stacktrace and fail a test before hitting the recursion
limit.

Change-Id: I643f49d07f3a894ad7edfbee8fb1949bbad6b910
Related-Bug: #1825435

The depends-on oslo.config patch is top of master so that forces the test runs in this patch to use unreleased oslo changes. I looked through the diff between the last release (6.8.1) where we see the issue and the master and the only seemingly relevant change is I535640779da645e43ba6586308b07bf25dba7d89 so this most probably does not matter in our reproduction trials'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-04-26 10:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I looked into the log the recent run produced. What we see is that the self.__cache does not contain the queried value multiple times. However that cache is cleared in may different reasons. See the extensive usage of the __clear_cache[1] decorator. In the other hand our extra counter is not cleared when the cache cleared. So I think what the current test run shows can be simply a result of some __clear_cache call.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/0bc22839b09fcd7ae2de4f7fe5d63ac055fd0a78/oslo_config/cfg.py#L2047'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-04-26 10:41:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
DNM: debug config opts infinite recursion

Only run the py36 unit test jobs and require oslo.config
for co-gating so we can pull in the dependent change.

Depends-On: I643f49d07f3a894ad7edfbee8fb1949bbad6b910

Change-Id: I5e55e3878c8de5ef20c605ad4805adb42dad5493
Related-Bug: #1825435

commit_message:
Add parameter to configure maxdelay in db purge/archive job

This patch introduces new parameters, CinderCronDbPurgeMaxDelay
and NovaCronDBArchivedMaxDelay, which enable us to configure
maxdelay parameter in cinder db purge cron job and nova db archive
cron job, like HeatCronPurgeDeletedMaxDelay which is used to
configure maxdelay in heat cron job.

Closes-Bug: #1823274
Change-Id: I112a228ed90a50aeee787e83a58a014519db7992

commit_message:
Update Python 3 containers to use Fedora 29

Please note that it still forces Python 3.6 as eventlet doesn't work
with Python 3.7, which is the default Python in 29.

Change-Id: If5ac58274c2edec9881fef60ac9f3bf0377aa5f4

commit_message:
Change setype for non container /var/log/<service> directories

/var/log/<service> is not used by containers, therefore setype
svirt_sandbox_file_t is not required. This changes it to the
default var_log_t.

Change-Id: I870f6f5286ac9222d6d8fbdcb48fe6b6559993ba

our repo.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-27399 : SUCCESS in 2h 22m 26s'}, {'account_id': 15398, 'date': '2019-04-01 14:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

openssl cmdline utility generates many informational, warning, and error messages on stderr. There is a new warning message which is now triggered when we try to encode things as required by xen apis, about what is now considered insecure by openssl upstream. But there is little we can do about this, as we are not dictating how encryption in xen api works. The best way is to fix this is to change the key derivation to one that is considered secure and supported by xen apis. But i do not have access to xen stuff, to figure out if such an upgrade is possible.

Reading the enc_main code of openssl the return code is initialized to 1, and only changed to 0 once everything is fine. Some warnings are harmless, and others result in early return from the function with error code 1. Thus it is absolute correct to simply check the error code - as return code will be 0 only if everything succeeds, but possibly with harmless warnings printed on stderr. Anything of substance will result in return code 1 with explanatory messages on stderr.

I like this new patch, and it complete solves the compatibliy of nova with 1.1.1+ based OpenSSL when using xen apis.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-04-02 12:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@eric, any thoughts on who else we could ask to review this to help it move forward?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-02 16:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

i think this is sane as a minimal refactor
but i would also personally try to stop using processutils as a followup patch'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-02 16:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2019-02-08 19:16:48.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi/agent: Change openssl error handling

Prior to this patch, if the openssl command returned a zero exit code
and wrote details to stderr, nova would raise a RuntimeError exception.
This patch changes the behavior to only raise a RuntimeError exception
when openssl returns a non-zero exit code. Regardless of the exit code
a warning will always be logged with stderr details if stderr is not
None. Note that processutils.execute will now raise a
processutils.ProcessExecutionError exception for any non-zero exit code
since we are passing check_exit_code=True.

Thanks to Dimitri John Ledkov <xnox@ubuntu.com> for the initial
version of this patch.

Change-Id: I212ac2b5ccd93e00adb7b9fe102fcb70857c6073

commit_message:
xenapi/agent: Change openssl error handling

Prior to this patch, if the openssl command returned a zero exit code
and wrote details to stderr, nova would raise a RuntimeError exception.
This patch changes the behavior to only raise a RuntimeError exception
when openssl returns a non-zero exit code. Regardless of the exit code
a warning will always be logged with stderr details if stderr is not
None. Note that processutils.execute will now raise a
processutils.ProcessExecutionError exception for any non-zero exit code
since we are passing check_exit_code=True, which we convert to a
Runtime error.

Thanks to Dimitri John Ledkov <xnox@ubuntu.com> and Eric Fried
<openstack@fried.cc> for helping with this patch.

Change-Id: I212ac2b5ccd93e00adb7b9fe102fcb70857c6073
Partial-Bug: #1771506

commit_message:
nova: Cleanup specfile

This is a basic cleanup and also a sync with the approach we are using
for other spec templates (eg the defaultconf). Also some of the SUSE
stuff we currently have downstream was added.

Change-Id: I88dbdd9981b05f65b1d6f3b0f0cb0a7fb29b296b

If I was reading it correctly, it's not really possible to customise it, because it's basically

That "..." is known not to reset filters is probably OK.  But using it again afterwards -- any plugin etc could potentially reset the variable (it's a common term) and cause a weird breakage later on.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 14:12:41.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set  scheduler_available_fitlers

Tempest's scheduler_available_filters has a special 'all' value that
is understood to mean 'all filters are enabled' by various tempest
tests. However, what it really means is 'the default nova filters are
enabled.' In an effort to help clean that up, this patch explicitly
sets scheduler_available_filters to nova's $FILTERS.

Change-Id: I6ffc1e9989cd61d666f9c1db9c94fbabd7151918
Related-bug: 1628443

commit_message:
Explicitly set scheduler_available_filters

Tempest's scheduler_available_filters has a special 'all' value that
is understood to mean 'all filters are enabled' by various tempest
tests. However, what it really means is 'the default nova filters are
enabled.' In an effort to help clean that up, this patch explicitly
sets scheduler_available_filters to nova's $FILTERS. Because $FILTERS
is now used in both lib/nova and lib/tempest, it is renamed
$NOVA_FILTERS.

Change-Id: I6ffc1e9989cd61d666f9c1db9c94fbabd7151918
Related-bug: 1628443

Fix IPv6 in Active/Standby topology on CentOS

commit_message:
Create VNF with parameter file using scaling policy

If user provides parameter file while creating VNF using scaling
policy, earlier it was failing with error 'The Parameter was not
provided" This patch allows creation of VNF using scaling policy
with parameter file.

APIImpact
Return 200 instead of 400 error when VNF is created using scaling
policy with parameter file

Change-Id: If102519127a3ef63449ab59f849e8cfaaa3ae62b
Closes-Bug: #1799683
(cherry picked from commit 68e06e243527826e9c58cfd7f2f1f5ab80f854a3)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Application Credentials: Set unrestricted Default to False

This is bug from initial commit Ida2e836cf81d2b96e0b66afed29a900c312223a4

Check box 'unrestricted' is Bool type and if left unticked it was set to
'None' which is not Bool type.

This fixes the bug and removes 'or None' which sets the 'unrestricted' to
'False'

Change-Id: I7b3b4b82624e61edfea5d0b42d9179ec2216277f
Closes-Bug: #1821115

commit_message:
Check if glance_upgrading is defined before using it

glance_upgrading variable is defined only during rolling upgrades, but
its value is checked on every call to "Restart glance-api container" handler.

Closes-Bug: #1826511
Change-Id: Idc95306c50a09666ac0a12e975307a42aef9e352
(cherry picked from commit f5b52608663bea5bbe1d58eff1a7bdfd21568173)

commit_message:
Fix spare amphora failover

Failover of spare amphorae failed with an exception,
because they're not attached to any loadbalancer.

This commit fixes this issue, allowing to rotate/update
spare amphora images.

Story: 2005470
Task: 30549

Change-Id: I9c9002486a9a547a215514c24ccb95f039b23ec2

commit_message:
Add python3 support for source install

Previously the installing of tempest via source (pip/tox/etc) assumed
python2. With newer versions we are switching to python3 so we need to
use the python3 version of tooling. Additionally easy_install has been
removed from python3-setuptools on Ubuntu 18.04 so we need to install
pip via the package instead of trying to install pip via source.

Change-Id: I6dc78a509a92de77d0b6d0808a6789cddd832c13

Switch ubuntu to use python3 packages for tempest deps

Use the package version of the dependencies on Ubuntu rather than try to
install the dependencies from source using pip.

commit_message:
Drop admin endpoints

The admin endpoints offer no special functionality, users may talk to
the public endpoints instead. The only historic use case has been the
keystone v2 admin endpoint, but with keystone v3 API, even that is no
longer needed.

Also stop creating cache dirs that were only needed while keystone
supported PKI tokens.

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-specs/src/branch/master/specs/ocata/all/drop-admin-endpoints.rst

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/652050
Change-Id: If6226717a359b8e09b5d28077e7adaff82055626

instead[1].

[{'created': '2019-02-28 16:05:33.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use aggregate_add_host in nova-manage

some report client logic (aggregate_add_host) to do provider aggregate
retrieval and update so as not to duplicate a call to retrieve the
host's resource provider record. It also left a TODO to handle
generation conflicts.

the host name or RP UUID, and refactor the nova-manage placement
sync_aggregates code to use it.

commit_message:
Use aggregate_add_host in nova-manage

When nova-manage placement sync_aggregates was added [1], it duplicated
some report client logic (aggregate_add_host) to do provider aggregate
retrieval and update so as not to duplicate a call to retrieve the
host's resource provider record. It also left a TODO to handle
generation conflicts.

Here we change the signature of aggregate_add_host to accept *either*
the host name or RP UUID, and refactor the nova-manage placement
sync_aggregates code to use it.

The behavior in terms of exit codes and messaging should be largely
unchanged, though there may be some subtle differences in corner cases.

[1] Iac67b6bf7e46fbac02b9d3cb59efc3c59b9e56c8

Change-Id: Iaa4ddf786ce7d31d2cee660d5196e5e530ec4bd3

commit_message:
Deprecate idle_timeout option

The idle_timeout parameter is deprecated, use connection_recycle_time
instead[1].

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/334182/

Change-Id: I684b2cd4973adc7d4ece83e620fd053e191bb19f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/656106/
Closes-Bug: #1826692

commit_message:
fix and reverse unit tests about network_segment_ranges

some unit tests can not been passed as stein version neutron refreshed.
this patch is to fixed some problems about the loading
network_segment_ranges db error and reverse other related unit tests.

Change-Id: I55448c9313e890d36e58e25077e4e00945f96ca9
signed-off-by:  zhangchi <zhangchi@szzt.com.cn>
co-Authored-By: tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>

commit_message:
Check if glance_upgrading is defined before using it

glance_upgrading variable is defined only during rolling upgrades, but
its value is checked on every call to "Restart glance-api container" handler.

Closes-Bug: #1826511
Change-Id: Idc95306c50a09666ac0a12e975307a42aef9e352

subject: Set min-ready 0 on vexxhost specific labels
messages: [{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2019-04-26 13:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-04-26 14:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-04-29 06:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-26 13:52:22.000000000', 'message': "Set min-ready 0 on vexxhost specific labels

It seems these nodes are not used very often, compared to other labels
on vexxhost.  By drop these 3 to zero, it means we can can 3 more nodes
for 99% of the time.  Give that vexxhost is a fast booting clouds, this
shouldn't impact job runtimes too much for tests that use these specific
labels.

Change-Id: I7e6f6e2395448cb241a76de450771c63452a93ec
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Set min-ready 0 on vexxhost specific labels

It seems these nodes are not used very often, compared to other labels
on vexxhost.  By drop these 3 to zero, it means we can can 3 more nodes
for 99% of the time.  Give that vexxhost is a fast booting clouds, this
shouldn't impact job runtimes too much for tests that use these specific
labels.

Change-Id: I7e6f6e2395448cb241a76de450771c63452a93ec
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move legacy-periodic-package-stackviz-element to stackviz repo

Below patch moves the legacy-periodic-package-stackviz-element job
to stackviz repo.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641918/

This is master only periodic job so safe to remove once
depends-on merge.

This commit removes that job from zuul-legacy-jobs.yaml
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641918/

Change-Id: I4edf85fbf5c82b5b1eaebdeb4f912a663ff5e459

commit_message:
Use tox-docs job in periodic for Stein

Doc generator job was replaced in Stein from
'build-openstack-sphinx-docs' to 'openstack-tox-docs',
so use that in periodic test jobs from stable/stein on.

Change-Id: I43adc20ef8a51748784b3adb1b65d66550586ecc

commit_message:
Increase retries to mitigate intermittent failure

Keystone seems to encounter an error on upgrades where the fetched admin
record is missing mfa options. With enough retries the record is fetched
correctly. This is a workaround for what is likely a failure invalidate
old cache data.

Related Change-Id: I3995d40535c60742f47f905c862482a9a2fea5ae
Closes-Bug: 1793389

Change-Id: I2cac72abe71d3a40fe14189526cb9aa27dfc91d1

Keystone seems to encounter an error on upgrades where the fetched
admin record is missing mfa options. With enough retries the record
is fetched correctly.

commit_message:
Remove _ceilometer_check_for_storage check

We can check from the history[0], actually it doesn't matter if
gnocchi or panko is started first., so this check is unnecessary.
Also when i want to migration using native zuulv3, the enabled
plugins is in the alphabetical order, so this will caused can not
install devstack correctly.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/387620
[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/99/651999/3/check/telemetry-integration-test/9066108/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2019-04-17_07_26_30_988
Change-Id: I5cbd93739f75b8141f8b79ae03bb8b99756b2a38
(cherry picked from commit 27eb3f431e177054789ef47859517d10862bc902)
(cherry picked from commit ac190d5087e17231cb388882e68029e17327deca)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-13 15:35:26.000000000', 'message': 'Allow driver to specify switch&port for faster lookup

Nova currently gets passed the network per name
(https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vif.py#L134-L147)
and looks that up in a linear fashion
(https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/network_util.py#L104-L118)

The operation scales O(n) and in our landscape with more than 2000 port-groups in a cluster,
it takes up to several minutes, depending where in the list the port-group is.

The actual API to the vcenter requires a switchUuid and a portgroupKey,
which a driver might already have available and save instead in the vif_details:
(E.g: https://github.com/Mirantis/vmware-dvs/blob/master/networking_vsphere/ml2/dvs_mechanism_driver.py#L118-L122)
and passed on more or less directly to the vif_spec here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py#L447-L452

This cuts down instance creation times to a constant length,
independent of the number of port-groups.

Change-Id: Ie638f39ffc4f729778170904e2229d3f64788951
'}, {'created': '2018-11-14 12:00:02.000000000', 'message': 'Allow driver to specify switch&port for faster lookup

Nova currently gets passed the network per name
(https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vif.py#L134-L147)
and looks that up in a linear fashion
(https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/network_util.py#L104-L118)

The operation scales O(n) and in our landscape with more than 2000 port-groups in a cluster,
it takes up to several minutes, depending where in the list the port-group is.

The actual API to the vcenter requires a switchUuid and a portgroupKey,
which a driver might already have available and save instead in the vif_details:
(E.g: https://github.com/Mirantis/vmware-dvs/blob/master/networking_vsphere/ml2/dvs_mechanism_driver.py#L118-L122)
and passed on more or less directly to the vif_spec here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py#L447-L452

This cuts down instance creation times to a constant length,
independent of the number of port-groups.

Change-Id: Ie638f39ffc4f729778170904e2229d3f64788951
'}, {'created': '2018-11-20 11:40:39.000000000', 'message': 'Allow driver to specify switch&port for faster lookup

Nova currently gets passed the network per name
(https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vif.py#L134-L147)
and looks that up in a linear fashion
(https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/network_util.py#L104-L118)

The operation scales O(n) and in our landscape with more than 2000 port-groups in a cluster,
it takes up to several minutes, depending where in the list the port-group is.

The actual API to the vcenter requires a switchUuid and a portgroupKey,
which a driver might already have available and save instead in the vif_details:
(E.g: https://github.com/Mirantis/vmware-dvs/blob/master/networking_vsphere/ml2/dvs_mechanism_driver.py#L118-L122)
and passed on more or less directly to the vif_spec here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py#L447-L452

This cuts down instance creation times to a constant length,
independent of the number of port-groups.

Change-Id: Ie638f39ffc4f729778170904e2229d3f64788951
'}]
commit_message:
Allow driver to specify switch&port for faster lookup

Nova currently gets passed the network per name
(https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vif.py#L134-L147)
and looks that up in a linear fashion
(https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/network_util.py#L104-L118)

The operation scales O(n) and in our landscape with more than 2000 port-groups in a cluster,
it takes up to several minutes, depending where in the list the port-group is.

The actual API to the vcenter requires a switchUuid and a portgroupKey,
which a driver might already have available and save instead in the vif_details:
(E.g: https://github.com/Mirantis/vmware-dvs/blob/master/networking_vsphere/ml2/dvs_mechanism_driver.py#L118-L122)
and passed on more or less directly to the vif_spec here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py#L447-L452

This cuts down instance creation times to a constant length,
independent of the number of port-groups.

Change-Id: Ie638f39ffc4f729778170904e2229d3f64788951

commit_message:
Update to https:// version of *openstack.org urls

The non-encrypted urls are just redirecting to https, so we
can save one roundtrip by linking the encrypted versions directly.

Change-Id: I88fe8b8c8ccfb5471f59f7898a69bf62cb6cfcaf

Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I0d0a3f62d652853963dc4fe204a413eec2bc1830

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 16:02:23.000000000', 'message': "make Patrole to run for shared network env

Devstack added to create the shared network for tempest testing
which makes sure tempest and other testing part works fine when
testing env has shared network.

- https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/683454f319246c3bda088b5e0325c5673263ce08/lib/tempest#L259

Now patrole started failing because of the above shared network.
Details: {u'message': u'Multiple possible networks found, use a
Network ID to be more specific.', u'code': 409}

http://logs.openstack.org/55/648255/1/check/patrole-admin/63b6639/testr_results.html.gz

When patrol tests call create_tesrt_server, network id is not passed
as kwargs which means it reply on tempest to add the network id for
creating the server[1]. Tempest fail to add the network id because it
relies on used credential to have the network created for them[2].

We should create the network for requested credential using
set_network_resources() method.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/75ea3dbaf9d459f6b1e72644bfa73520142e17d1/tempest/api/compute/base.py#L234
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/3639f91c36dbbcc8ecf9373aeb0cec83af468b81/tempest/lib/common/fixed_network.py#L95

Story: 2005369
Task: 30345

Change-Id: I1281aa090c167c1e3e401a1707d196a69e7b5cd2

commit_message:
make Patrole to run for shared network env

Devstack added to create the shared network for tempest testing
which makes sure tempest and other testing part works fine when
testing env has shared network.

- https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/683454f319246c3bda088b5e0325c5673263ce08/lib/tempest#L259

Now patrole started failing because of the above shared network.
Details: {u'message': u'Multiple possible networks found, use a
Network ID to be more specific.', u'code': 409}

http://logs.openstack.org/55/648255/1/check/patrole-admin/63b6639/testr_results.html.gz

When patrol tests call create_tesrt_server, network id is not passed
as kwargs which means it reply on tempest to add the network id for
creating the server[1]. Tempest fail to add the network id because it
relies on used credential to have the network created for them[2].

We should create the network for requested credential using
set_network_resources() method.

Following tests are skipped due to their failure due to bad request error:
- test_update_network_provider_network_type[id-d064ef96-662b-47b6-94b7-9106dcd7ba8c]
- test_update_network_provider_physical_network[id-e3a55660-f75c-494e-a1b1-a8b36cc789ef]
- test_update_network_provider_segmentation_id[id-f6164228-b670-45fd-9ff9-b101930318c7]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/75ea3dbaf9d459f6b1e72644bfa73520142e17d1/tempest/api/compute/base.py#L234
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/3639f91c36dbbcc8ecf9373aeb0cec83af468b81/tempest/lib/common/fixed_network.py#L95

Story: 2005369
Task: 30345

Change-Id: I1281aa090c167c1e3e401a1707d196a69e7b5cd2

commit_message:
Override ceph_mon to v2 protocol

As we're running ceph scenarios using nautilus containers,
we need to disable mon_host v1 protocol in ceph.conf to make
the mon bootstrap phase work correctly as per Red Hat BZ #1697977

Change-Id: I7af4afce59206a1f471c7866c34823739fff34c2
Depends-On: I743a002e5d21a3a150727fda2117a04d4c389d38
Depends-On: I133cd0cd632e0ba6b5a844a89bf74a063cf50f07

This patch adds the provider flavor capabilities service client to the
Octavia tempest plugin.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 21:47:47.000000000', 'message': 'Make nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI.router a singleton

When starting nova-api before any nova-computes are started
and registered in the cell DBs, and with
[upgrade_levels]/compute=auto, the compute RPC API client
construction will iterate all cells looking for a minimum
nova-compute service version, not find one, and thus not
cache the result in the LAST_VERSION global.

There are 30+ API controller classes that construct an
instance of nova.compute.api.API which itself constructs
a nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI object which determines
the version cap as described above, and that is per API
worker. Each cell DB call goes through RequestContext.set_target_cell
which has a lock in it, so in this scenario on start of
nova-api there can be a lot of locking log messages for
get_or_set_cached_cell_and_set_connections.

The RPC API ClientRouter can be a singleton and just constructed
on first access to avoid the redundant database queries which
is what this change does.

Change-Id: I48109d5e32a2e9635c240da1c77f7f6cc7e3c76d
Related-Bug: #1807219
'}, {'created': '2019-04-15 21:59:55.000000000', 'message': 'Make nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI.router a singleton

There are 30+ API controller classes that construct an

a nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI object which determines
the version cap as described above, and that is per API

which has a lock in it, so in this scenario on start of
nova-api there can be a lot of locking log messages for

The RPC API ClientRouter can be a singleton and just constructed
on first access to avoid the redundant database queries which
is what this change does.

Change-Id: I48109d5e32a2e9635c240da1c77f7f6cc7e3c76d
Related-Bug: #1807219
Related-Bug: #1815697
'}, {'created': '2019-04-25 00:01:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI.router a singleton

When starting nova-api before any nova-computes are started
and registered in the cell DBs, and with
[upgrade_levels]/compute=auto, the compute RPC API client
construction will iterate all cells looking for a minimum
nova-compute service version, not find one, and thus not
cache the result in the LAST_VERSION global.

There are 30+ API controller classes that construct an
instance of nova.compute.api.API which itself constructs
a nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI object which determines
the version cap as described above, and that is per API
worker. Each cell DB call goes through RequestContext.set_target_cell
which has a lock in it, so in this scenario on start of
nova-api there can be a lot of locking log messages for
get_or_set_cached_cell_and_set_connections.

The RPC API ClientRouter can be a singleton and just constructed
on first access to avoid the redundant database queries which
is what this change does.

To preserve the LAST_VERSION re-calculation that was in
ComputeManager.reset(), we have to also reset the _ROUTER global
so ComputeManager.reset() now resets all of the compute RPC API
globals.

Change-Id: I48109d5e32a2e9635c240da1c77f7f6cc7e3c76d
Related-Bug: #1807219
Related-Bug: #1815697
'}]
commit_message:
Make nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI.router a singleton

When starting nova-api before any nova-computes are started
and registered in the cell DBs, and with
[upgrade_levels]/compute=auto, the compute RPC API client
construction will iterate all cells looking for a minimum
nova-compute service version, not find one, and thus not
cache the result in the LAST_VERSION global.

There are 30+ API controller classes that construct an
instance of nova.compute.api.API which itself constructs
a nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI object which determines
the version cap as described above, and that is per API
worker. Each cell DB call goes through RequestContext.set_target_cell
which has a lock in it, so in this scenario on start of
nova-api there can be a lot of locking log messages for
get_or_set_cached_cell_and_set_connections.

The RPC API ClientRouter can be a singleton and just constructed
on first access to avoid the redundant database queries which
is what this change does.

To preserve the LAST_VERSION re-calculation that was in
ComputeManager.reset(), we have to also reset the _ROUTER global
so ComputeManager.reset() now resets all of the compute RPC API
globals.

Change-Id: I48109d5e32a2e9635c240da1c77f7f6cc7e3c76d
Related-Bug: #1807219
Related-Bug: #1815697

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-26 18:08:21.000000000', 'message': "Add presence tracking commands

Add in/out/seen commands to let people voluntarily check in and out of
tracks and other arbitrary locations, to make it easy for others to
find them.  Of course this is entirely optional.

It's designed to cope gracefully with people forgetting to check out
of locations they previously checked into.

Change-Id: I0d88a540ad7a333841c208dd7f2a7247897eb238
"}]
commit_message:
Add presence tracking commands

Add in/out/seen commands to let people voluntarily check in and out of
tracks and other arbitrary locations, to make it easy for others to
find them.  Of course this is entirely optional.

It's designed to cope gracefully with people forgetting to check out
of locations they previously checked into.

Change-Id: I0d88a540ad7a333841c208dd7f2a7247897eb238

While using tap as service with ovs driver, I can see
that if the monitor port and the VM production port on
the same server the traffic for the monitor port is tagged
with the local vlan of the port. I am not sure why it happen
becasuse the monitor port is configured to be in access of the
local vlan

Change-Id: Iad1aa5805448d097ea69b950ee09ed12685a3337
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: fix monitor port got get packet without vlan

While using tap as service with ovs driver, I can see
that if the monitor port and the VM production port on
the same server the traffic for the monitor port is tagged
with the local vlan of the port. I am not sure why it happen
becasuse the monitor port is configured to be in access of the
local vlan

Change-Id: Iad1aa5805448d097ea69b950ee09ed12685a3337

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-26 21:22:49.000000000', 'message': 'Create request spec, build request and mappings in one transaction

The transaction context is currently not shared when creating the
RequestSpec, BuildRequest and InstanceMapping.  Because of this,
it is possible that the database ends in an inconsistent state
due to the fact that one of these was created and the system
crashed afterwards.

This patch adds a function which handles the creation of all those
resources in a single transaction.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1784093

Change-Id: If897a0d721180152ebdceb7a0c23e8f283ce6d10
(cherry picked from commit 85f8d033d27b31a6398529e0a25da74eae523b08)
'}]
commit_message:
Create request spec, build request and mappings in one transaction

The transaction context is currently not shared when creating the
RequestSpec, BuildRequest and InstanceMapping.  Because of this,
it is possible that the database ends in an inconsistent state
due to the fact that one of these was created and the system
crashed afterwards.

This patch adds a function which handles the creation of all those
resources in a single transaction.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1784093

Change-Id: If897a0d721180152ebdceb7a0c23e8f283ce6d10
(cherry picked from commit 85f8d033d27b31a6398529e0a25da74eae523b08)

commit_message:
Ensure there is no redis on host

In the past releases overcloud-full image could contained redis package
even though containerized deployment has been used. This is problematic
during minor update, so we need to make sure the package is removed.

Change-Id: I827dd918bb83c67c6e02a4d91fed2a6959361283

[{'created': '2019-04-26 20:33:52.000000000', 'message': "tripleo-bootstrap: only enable network, not starting.

Starting the service can fail is the script was run before.
The task is really to enable the network after a reboot, so let's just
make sure we enable the service, and not need to start it.

Change-Id: Ib8fb5e9154091f80a08c272df014bea25c39c475
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo-bootstrap: only enable network, not starting.

Starting the service can fail is the script was run before.
The task is really to enable the network after a reboot, so let's just
make sure we enable the service, and not need to start it.

Change-Id: Ib8fb5e9154091f80a08c272df014bea25c39c475

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 14:33:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix port update of host_id in case of baremetal instance

In case of baremetal overcloud, the instance ports gets updated during instance reboot
to change host_id to be the nova compute host_id.

This way baremetal ports' host_id will be changed to indicate the nova host_id
instead of ironic node uuid.

In case of normal instance or even baremetal instance it wouldn't be a problem but
in case of SmartNIC baremetal instance the port's host_id is important to communicate
with the relevant Neutron agent running on the SmartNIC as the port's host_id contains
the SmartNIC host name.

Change-Id: I47d1aba17cd2e9fff67846cc243c8fbd9ac21659
Closes-Bug: #1822801
"}, {'created': '2019-04-04 13:18:31.000000000', 'message': "Do not perform port update in case of baremetal instance.

In case of a baremetal instance, the instance's port binding:host_id
gets updated during instance reboot to the nova compute host id by
the periodic task: _heal_instance_info_cache.

This is an un-desirable change as ironic did the original port binding
nova MUST not update the value.
In case of a baremetal port, the binding:host_id represents the ironic
node_uuid. In case of a SmartNIC(baremetal) port[1] the binding:host_id
represent the SmartNIC hostname and it MUST not change since ironic
relies on that information as well as Neutron agent on the SmartNIC.

In case the compute manager manages baremetal instances
(compute_driver = 'ironic.IronicDriver') _heal_instance_info_cache()
results in a no-op.

[1] I658754f7f8c74087b0aabfdef222a2c0b5698541

Change-Id: I47d1aba17cd2e9fff67846cc243c8fbd9ac21659
Closes-Bug: #1822801

"}, {'created': '2019-04-17 08:00:33.000000000', 'message': 'Do not perform port update in case of baremetal instance.

In case of a baremetal instance, the instance's port binding:host_id
gets updated during instance reboot to the nova compute host id by
the periodic task: _heal_instance_info_cache. This regression was
introduced in commit: I75fd15ac2a29e420c09499f2c41d11259ca811ae

This is an un-desirable change as ironic virt driver did the original
port binding, nova should not update the value.
In case of a baremetal port, the binding:host_id represents the ironic
node_uuid. In case of a SmartNIC(baremetal) port[1] the binding:host_id
represent the SmartNIC hostname and it MUST not change since ironic
relies on that information as well as the Neutron agent that runs on
the SmartNIC.

A new API method was added, "manages_port_bindings()", to ComputeDriver
that defaults to False, and overriden in IronicDriver to True.

A call to this API method is now made in _heal_instance_info_cache() to prevent
port update for instance ports in case the underlying ComputeDriver manages the
port binding.

[1] I658754f7f8c74087b0aabfdef222a2c0b5698541

commit_message:
Do not perform port update in case of baremetal instance.

In case of a baremetal instance, the instance's port binding:host_id
gets updated during instance reboot to the nova compute host id by
the periodic task: _heal_instance_info_cache. This regression was
introduced in commit: I75fd15ac2a29e420c09499f2c41d11259ca811ae

This is an un-desirable change as ironic virt driver did the original
port binding, nova should not update the value.
In case of a baremetal port, the binding:host_id represents the ironic
node_uuid. In case of a SmartNIC(baremetal) port[1] the binding:host_id
represent the SmartNIC hostname and it MUST not change since ironic
relies on that information as well as the Neutron agent that runs on
the SmartNIC.

A new API method was added, "manages_port_bindings()", to ComputeDriver
that defaults to False, and overriden in IronicDriver to True.

A call to this API method is now made in _heal_instance_info_cache() to
prevent port update for instance ports in case the underlying
ComputeDriver manages the port binding.

[1] I658754f7f8c74087b0aabfdef222a2c0b5698541

Change-Id: I47d1aba17cd2e9fff67846cc243c8fbd9ac21659
Closes-Bug: #1822801

commit_message:
Call roles to add/remove build-specific SSH key

This assumes pre/post are always run in trusted context and thus have
access to the private SSH key.

Change-Id: I27d1939e811d5f7d8720fc9288ea5bb89605f1fe
Depends-On: I2482da835bcec68bb09b9a73cb45d2f0bc86feb3

commit_message:
Stop providing os-testr

Community has moved onwards to use stestr, so we don't need it anymore.
Converting the last use actually uncovered real bugs that weren't found
before so this is a good thing.

Change-Id: Icfcccba6b941e802aa275f66146c105767794ff9
(cherry picked from commit 54969e8fc1df1ffb80b5f1d00ac864fc68428ef6)

commit_message:
Abandon parallel-scheduler backlog spec

Scrubbing the backlog directory.

This spec has been here since 2015.

The original authors should feel free to modify or downvote this commit
if the spec should continue to be considered for implementation now or
in the future.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-11 06:26:37.000000000', 'message': 'DVR-HA: Unbinding a HA router from agent does not clear HA interface

Removing an active or a standby HA router from an agent that has a
valid DVR serviceable port (such as DHCP), does not remove the
HA interface associated with the Router in the SNAT namespace.

When we try to add the HA router back to the agent, then it
adds more than one HA interface to the SNAT Namespace causing
more problems and we sometimes also see multiple active routers.

This bug might have been introduced by this patch [1].

Fix the problem by just adding the router namespaces without HA
interfaces when there is no HA and re-insert the HA interfaces
when HA router is bound to the agent into the namespace.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522362/
Closes-Bug: #1816698

Change-Id: Ie625abcb73f8185bb2bee06dcd26a01d8af0b0d1
(cherry picked from commit d9e0bab6acf6a608ed5bf32524c7d362f052a3ac)

commit_message:
DVR-HA: Unbinding a HA router from agent does not clear HA interface

Removing an active or a standby HA router from an agent that has a
valid DVR serviceable port (such as DHCP), does not remove the
HA interface associated with the Router in the SNAT namespace.

When we try to add the HA router back to the agent, then it
adds more than one HA interface to the SNAT Namespace causing
more problems and we sometimes also see multiple active routers.

This bug might have been introduced by this patch [1].

Fix the problem by just adding the router namespaces without HA
interfaces when there is no HA and re-insert the HA interfaces
when HA router is bound to the agent into the namespace.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522362/
Conflicts:
          neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
Closes-Bug: #1816698

Change-Id: Ie625abcb73f8185bb2bee06dcd26a01d8af0b0d1
(cherry picked from commit d9e0bab6acf6a608ed5bf32524c7d362f052a3ac)

commit_message:
Fix puppet unit ci config

We no longer use puppet 4.x so lets drop that job. Additionally we made
the 6.0 version voting but forgot to add it to the gate.

commit_message:
Run nova_cell_v2_discover_hosts.py on every deploy run

Change I1a159a7c2ac286373df2b7c566426b37b7734961 moved the dicovery
to run on a single compute host to not race on simultanious nova-manage
commands. This change make sure we run the discover on every deploy run
which is required for scaling up events.

Change-Id: Iba7a4aeeeeb94ffbbaf4bb757672091807301494
Related-bug: 1824445
(cherry picked from commit dfc99bad085f7d49d57c8a8ea299a9ffd06cacd6)

commit_message:
Run nova-manage as root to prevent wrong nova-manage.log permissions

To verify if the default cell is created we run a nova-manage command.
Right now this is triggered as root and not as nova like the otheres.
In case it is the first time on the node it creates the nova-manage.log
with root user and follow up call as nova user will fail.

Related-bug: 1820590

Change-Id: I56a961615c0afa748a42c25d4614637275b7c33b
(cherry picked from commit 08015d6f9166e9e62bb7ff3f38c5d7e08ba646e5)
(cherry picked from commit 4a6ba2bbaa5a813a4dad61b7c20c04ee77381395)

commit_message:
Run nova-manage as root to prevent wrong nova-manage.log permissions

To verify if the default cell is created we run a nova-manage command.
Right now this is triggered as root and not as nova like the otheres.
In case it is the first time on the node it creates the nova-manage.log
with root user and follow up call as nova user will fail.

Related-bug: 1820590

Change-Id: I56a961615c0afa748a42c25d4614637275b7c33b
(cherry picked from commit 08015d6f9166e9e62bb7ff3f38c5d7e08ba646e5)
(cherry picked from commit 4a6ba2bbaa5a813a4dad61b7c20c04ee77381395)
(cherry picked from commit a968838990d485479bbe4ff15c80dafa51175082)

commit_message:
make kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-daemon-octavia non voting

The kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-daemon-octavia job frequently fails
due to unrelated kubernetes issues. we have seen this over
several relases as such this change makes it non voting
until such a time as it becomes stable.

Conflicts:
    .zuul.yaml

Change-Id: Idabea9ee8f796f9b455f3d56580e5473e5464fc0
(cherry picked from commit cef1ae6a4a44497727fa7f88b94c45a2aba5cfbe)

commit_message:
Run nova-manage as root to prevent wrong nova-manage.log permissions

To verify if the default cell is created we run a nova-manage command.
Right now this is triggered as root and not as nova like the otheres.
In case it is the first time on the node it creates the nova-manage.log
with root user and follow up call as nova user will fail.

Related-bug: 1820590

Change-Id: I56a961615c0afa748a42c25d4614637275b7c33b
(cherry picked from commit 08015d6f9166e9e62bb7ff3f38c5d7e08ba646e5)

commit_message:
Set HA failover bridges veth pair devices UP

The test bridge veth pair devices is not up which cause the
VRRP advertisement packet can not pass to each HA port. Then
multiple master router is up. This patch just sets the veth
pair devices up.

Closes-Bug: #1819160
Change-Id: I0e0d0311d73bce83d3c7341e7a0167917818b1ff
(cherry picked from commit 8cc480bd01d21f05296c77db231b706a7dc5b475)

commit_message:
Add a force field to audit

As now, Watcher doesn't allow to launch a new audit when there
is actionplan ongoing. This patch gives the choice to User,
if User set force when launching audit, Watcher will execute the
audit even other actionplan is ongoing.

Change-Id: I276ebcee0b09bfc6f27ec39f43ba2ecd230db2b2
Implements: blueprint add-force-field-to-audit

This is a combination of 2 commits:
* a fix for dependency issue on stable/rocky
* a cherry-picked commit from master.
Both are needed to fix check/gate issues on stable/rocky.

1. Use rocky version of neutron-lbaas

This is a stable/rocky only patch.

In test jobs without this fix the latest release of neutron-lbaas is
installed (14.0.0.0rc1, from Stein) during the task "tox : Run tox
without tests", which fails with the following error:

ContextualVersionConflict: (neutron-lib 1.18.0 ([..]),
Requirement.parse('neutron-lib>=1.25.0'), set(['neutron-lbaas']))

2. Use latest Oxygen release instead of snapshot

Oxygen daily snapshots are not built any more on ODL's nexus page [1].
The latest release is available [2], so let's use that to fix all
Oxygen based CI jobs.

[1] https://nexus.opendaylight.org/content/repositories/opendaylight.snapshot/org/opendaylight/integration/karaf/
[2] https://nexus.opendaylight.org/content/repositories/opendaylight.release/org/opendaylight/integration/karaf/

(cherry picked from commit 10962b1a48f7ce2d363f3775cf6ff0224942a1fd)

Change-Id: Icad46e8f24154871f052db944bf6feb835812796

commit_message:
Use only rocky version of neutron-lbaas and latest Oxygen

This is a combination of 2 commits:
* a fix for dependency issue on stable/rocky
* a cherry-picked commit from master.
Both are needed to fix check/gate issues on stable/rocky.

1. Use rocky version of neutron-lbaas

This is a stable/rocky only patch.

In test jobs without this fix the latest release of neutron-lbaas is
installed (14.0.0.0rc1, from Stein) during the task "tox : Run tox
without tests", which fails with the following error:

ContextualVersionConflict: (neutron-lib 1.18.0 ([..]),
Requirement.parse('neutron-lib>=1.25.0'), set(['neutron-lbaas']))

2. Use latest Oxygen release instead of snapshot

Oxygen daily snapshots are not built any more on ODL's nexus page [1].
The latest release is available [2], so let's use that to fix all
Oxygen based CI jobs.

[1] https://nexus.opendaylight.org/content/repositories/opendaylight.snapshot/org/opendaylight/integration/karaf/
[2] https://nexus.opendaylight.org/content/repositories/opendaylight.release/org/opendaylight/integration/karaf/

(cherry picked from commit 10962b1a48f7ce2d363f3775cf6ff0224942a1fd)

commit_message:
Remove 'bdm_(update_or_create|destroy)_at_top'

These were being called within the 'BlockDeviceMapping' object. Remove
them in their entirety, given that nothing should be calling them now.
Note that this effectively breaks cells v1 but that shouldn't matter,
given that it's no longer possible to use the thing.

Part of blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: I13fb0575317015128853ac093bccffe233f3c79f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 02:23:04.000000000', 'message': "Judge if data['key'] exists in Create Extra Spec Form under Volume Type Panel

Change-Id: I5ecdbb37953e95b302a254748cfc2a6a615c7d4b
Closes-Bug: #1822924
"}, {'created': '2019-04-03 06:16:53.000000000', 'message': "Judge if data['key'] exists

In Create Extra Spec Form under Volume Type Panel,
in the clean method, need to determine whether
data['key'] exists, because data['key'] does
not exist if the key does not match to the regex

Change-Id: I5ecdbb37953e95b302a254748cfc2a6a615c7d4b
Closes-Bug: #1822924
"}, {'created': '2019-04-04 01:47:29.000000000', 'message': 'Judge if data['key'] exists on Create Extra Spec Form

In Create Extra Spec Form under Volume Type Panel,
when an extra spec already exists,
create an extra spec with the name "#^&*" will report an error.

This bug is due to the fact that data["key"] does not exist,
but uses it.

Change-Id: I5ecdbb37953e95b302a254748cfc2a6a615c7d4b
Closes-Bug: #1822924
'}, {'created': '2019-04-04 14:22:13.000000000', 'message': 'Correct error messages of Create Extra Spec Form under Volume Type Panel

When there is more than one Extra Specs in Volume Type Extra 
Specs, then create an Extra spec with the Key name "#^&*", the 
form prompts an Wrong error. This patch correcting the error message.

Change-Id: I5ecdbb37953e95b302a254748cfc2a6a615c7d4b
Closes-Bug: #1822924
'}, {'created': '2019-04-08 01:37:03.000000000', 'message': 'Correct error messages of Create Extra Spec Form under Volume Type Panel

When there is more than one Extra Specs in Volume Type Extra

commit_message:
Correct error messages of Create Extra Spec Form under Volume Type Panel

When there is more than one Extra Specs in Volume Type Extra Specs,
then create an Extra spec with an invalid key name like "#^&*",
the form prompts a wrong error message.
This patch corrects the error message.

Change-Id: I5ecdbb37953e95b302a254748cfc2a6a615c7d4b
Closes-Bug: #1822924

We can check from the history[0], actually it doesn't matter if

commit_message:
Remove _ceilometer_check_for_storage check

We can check from the history[0], actually it doesn't matter if
gnocchi or panko is started first., so this check is unnecessary.
Also when i want to migration using native zuulv3, the enabled
plugins is in the alphabetical order, so this will caused can not
install devstack correctly.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/387620
[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/99/651999/3/check/telemetry-integration-test/9066108/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2019-04-17_07_26_30_988
Change-Id: I5cbd93739f75b8141f8b79ae03bb8b99756b2a38
(cherry picked from commit 27eb3f431e177054789ef47859517d10862bc902)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-23 04:15:35.000000000', 'message': "Pass on region when we don't have a valid ironic endpoint

If for some reason we don't have a valid endpoint to provide the
Ironic client, we should at the very least provide the information

commit_message:
Pass on region when we don't have a valid ironic endpoint

If for some reason we don't have a valid endpoint to provide the
Ironic client, we should at the very least provide the information
it needs to make an informed decision.

Change-Id: I31fa1c6fb0b224fbb02f9ebf68abc6a3728e9389
Partial-Bug: #1825583

commit_message:
Create request spec, build request and mappings in one transaction

The transaction context is currently not shared when creating the
RequestSpec, BuildRequest and InstanceMapping.  Because of this,
it is possible that the database ends in an inconsistent state
due to the fact that one of these was created and the system
crashed afterwards.

This patch adds a function which handles the creation of all those
resources in a single transaction.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1784093

Change-Id: If897a0d721180152ebdceb7a0c23e8f283ce6d10

[{'created': '2019-04-27 07:37:39.000000000', 'message': 'mistral: Fix rundir handling

For any distro that uses systemd, /run is on tmpfs so we need to use
the systemd logic for dynamically generating rundir rather than
installing that. fixes lint failure on SUSE.

Change-Id: I6f5e5a5bf9b59c65b667e615fee77d5a8775d70e
'}]
commit_message:
mistral: Fix rundir handling

For any distro that uses systemd, /run is on tmpfs so we need to use
the systemd logic for dynamically generating rundir rather than
installing that. fixes lint failure on SUSE.

Change-Id: I6f5e5a5bf9b59c65b667e615fee77d5a8775d70e

commit_message:
Stop providing os-testr

Community has moved onwards to use stestr, so we don't need it anymore.
Converting the last use actually uncovered real bugs that weren't found
before so this is a good thing.

Change-Id: Icfcccba6b941e802aa275f66146c105767794ff9

The 001 failure [1] is because the ceph rbd client in the container is 12.x instead of 14.x. How do we get 14.x in this container?

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/39/651239/11/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone/0a49529/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/nova/nova-compute.log.txt.gz#_2019-04-12_20_28_18_941'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-04-15 14:45:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

In particular seems that 12.x doesn't like 14.x syntax (in terms of address format in ceph.conf) and cannot process parameters passed to the connection function.
We need to get 14.x and retest to confirm that this issue is related to mixed packages."}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-04-16 10:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-04-16 15:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2019-04-18 10:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 8b7590dd0ace604aa19bd320321928d7d9a32fc9'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2019-04-24 16:53:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

Putting soft -1 to understand the plan for non standalone scenarios and non CI Deployments with tripleo + ceph nautilus? @fmount, @fultonj just in case i missed some expect can you please clear it?

NOTE: i don't want to block it just want to understand the thoughts regarding the move. /me out for today, so putting the question in patch again. If i am still unclear with the question let me know."}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-04-24 19:09:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

@yatin, from the tests we've made we hit this issue only in standalone scenarios, so we don't want disable v1 by default in ceph templates because Nautilus come out by default with both v1 and v2 (and it adopted the new syntax as well): with more complex scenarios (multinode and network isolation) we didn't get this issue.
As per tests we've conducted, we also raise this upstream bug: 

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1824993

because we are able to make CI passes both disabling v1 and applying this hack on br-ex:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651231/2/deployment/ceph-ansible/ceph-base.yaml

IMHO this could be just a CI bug, so it's good to have the chance to toggle v1 protocol for fresh nautilus installations via ceph-ansible, but it's not correct to have it as default behaviour (it's not a technical limitation).
We can move forward right now with this review and keep investigating later the nature of this issue we encoured."}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-04-24 19:22:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

commit_message:
Override ceph_mon to v2 protocol

As we're running ceph scenarios using nautilus containers,
we need to disable mon_host v1 protocol in ceph.conf to make
the mon bootstrap phase work correctly as per Red Hat BZ #1697977

Change-Id: I7af4afce59206a1f471c7866c34823739fff34c2
Depends-On: I743a002e5d21a3a150727fda2117a04d4c389d38
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651287

commit_message:
Update default Ceph container image to use to the Nautilus version

From the OpenStack Stein release we want to deploy the Ceph Nautilus
version; this change updates the default container image to use accoringly.

Depends-On: Id0de75e7459b9a8d993a87552b51cf6fdbd29687
Change-Id: I133cd0cd632e0ba6b5a844a89bf74a063cf50f07

commit_message:
Pass kwargs to exception to get better format of error message

If we do not pass kwargs to exception, the parameter will be deemed
as message and will be displayed directly. This is to pass kwargs to
InvalidOperatorError and URLValidationError, to get better format of
error message.

Change-Id: I5220d7af077a6c2eb1fe49cbbd7421169fa5b015

I'm not sure what the point of this is/was, but melwitt said it came about because of the need to communicate an actual exception from scatter/gather routines. If that's the case, this seems massively overkill to me. Just setting/returning the exception that was raised for a specific cell in the result set should be more than enough to determine what happened in each cell. We'll be examining these linearly, not re-raising them, and deciding what to do based on what happened in each case. So, tl;dr; I don't think we need something complicated here."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-04-27 23:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

ill abandon this until we have a usecase that needs it.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 22:21:30.000000000', 'message': "Add Result wrapper class to nova common

- This change add a new result wrapper class
  nova.common.result.Result for packaging
  return values that may contain a value
  or an exception.

- This is an algebraic data type simlar
  to haskals Maybe Monad or C++'s std:expected

- This allows exections to be packed in the result of
  a function and reraised at a later date.

- The Result class support testing for the sucess of
  the fuction by evaluting the result with an if statement
  or by explcitly calling hasException on the result object

- The exception can be retrived without reraising if desired
  by calling getException(). Calling getException on a valid
  result object return None

- The value of the Result is acessed via the value property.
  acessing the value member when the result has an exception
  will reraise it otherwise it will return the packaged value.

- This is an immutable type via its public interface once
  constucted.

Change-Id: I9d070de717fc0c406b8887281a0909c382fd8daa

Change-Id: I9d070de717fc0c406b8887281a0909c382fd8daa

commit_message:
Add Result wrapper class to nova common

- This change add a new result wrapper class
  nova.common.result.Result for packaging
  return values that may contain a value
  or an exception.

- This is an algebraic data type simlar
  to haskals Maybe Monad or C++'s std:expected

- This allows exections to be packed in the result of
  a function and reraised at a later date.

- The Result class support testing for the sucess of
  the fuction by evaluting the result with an if statement
  or by explcitly calling hasException on the result object

- The exception can be retrived without reraising if desired
  by calling getException(). Calling getException on a valid
  result object return None

- The value of the Result is acessed via the value property.
  acessing the value member when the result has an exception
  will reraise it otherwise it will return the packaged value.

- This is an immutable type via its public interface once
  constucted.

Change-Id: I9d070de717fc0c406b8887281a0909c382fd8daa

commit_message:
this change fixes the low constratins tox env

- this change drop the min warlock version
  from 1.3.0 to 1.2.0 so that it can istall
  as 1.3.0 conflicts with outer requiremetns.
- this change fixes how the packages are installed
  in the lower-constratint env so that the values
  specifed in lower-constratints.txt are used
  instead of the global upper-constratints
- this chang does not fix the fact that the unitests
  do not pass with the lower constratints. someone
  who understands congress should proably to that
  in another revision of this patch.

Change-Id: Ic1be30b79de37e7a71f1228b162b8f35e5519b04

Change-Id: I6df0d5a2bb0d306b858dad8bbc3eff2cccb9bac6

commit_message:
enable oslo service to work with pypy

- This change disables installation of yappi for on pypy
- This change skips one test that does not work on pypy
- This change converts _capture_profile into a noop function
  when invoked on pypy.

Change-Id: I6df0d5a2bb0d306b858dad8bbc3eff2cccb9bac6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-07 09:32:19.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] testing seans-nfv-ci

- This is a test change which will be used
  to trigger builds via my personal ci.
- This is not intended to merge and is just
  to a place for me to test triggering the ci.
- This change disable jobs in the check and
  experimental pipeline and replaces them with
  the noop job to not waste upstream ci resouces

Change-Id: Ie4f19e9df2d0a03fb6b4d5a8c300036f53a73a60
'}]
commit_message:
[DNM] testing seans-nfv-ci

- This is a test change which will be used
  to trigger builds via my personal ci.
- This is not intended to merge and is just
  to a place for me to test triggering the ci.
- This change disable jobs in the check and
  experimental pipeline and replaces them with
  the noop job to not waste upstream ci resouces

Change-Id: Ie4f19e9df2d0a03fb6b4d5a8c300036f53a73a60

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 11:11:02.000000000', 'message': 'Give some HA router case specific resources

1. give each HA failover case an independent vrrp_id
2. give each HA port an independent IP address, so the
interface IPs for router HA ports will be:
    169.254.192.100 and 169.254.192.101
    169.254.192.102 and 169.254.192.103
    169.254.192.104 and 169.254.192.105
    169.254.192.106 and 169.254.192.107
VIP of each case will be:
    169.254.0.10/24
    169.254.0.11/24
    169.254.0.12/24
    169.254.0.13/24
    169.254.0.14/24

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py

commit_message:
Give some HA router case specific resources

1. give each HA failover case an independent vrrp_id
2. give each HA port an independent IP address, so the
interface IPs for router HA ports will be:
    169.254.192.100 and 169.254.192.101
    169.254.192.102 and 169.254.192.103
    169.254.192.104 and 169.254.192.105
    169.254.192.106 and 169.254.192.107
VIP of each case will be:
    169.254.0.10/24
    169.254.0.11/24
    169.254.0.12/24
    169.254.0.13/24
    169.254.0.14/24

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py

Closes-Bug: #1819160
Change-Id: I1216d96af40449ec16a852cc1f6c4f15c85f4546
(cherry picked from commit c69a87405af6b632a3edd9c6fe5ee63a5bc07eb1)
(cherry picked from commit 2c5957f56d46d99b8eb1e7651afcbf8fa9f426a0)
(cherry picked from commit c50bdf232992f0431f15cbe7cfb9f7eaa3a9ff0c)
